course_title: Introduction to Clinical and Translational Science
course_description: This course introduces the fundamentals of human subjects research in CTR. It begins with the building blocks of hypothesis development, population and study sample selection, defining study measures, and power and sample size calculations. The course then conducts a broad survey of observational and experimental study designs, including systematic review and meta-analysis. Throughout the semester the team science aspect of CTR is emphasized with students working together in groups in organized class and on-line activities.
schedule_location: M 1pm-2:50pm in Grace Crum Rollins L35
